intro: Malvastrum linoides, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to lavender flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its fibrous stems and mucilaginous properties. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
